Package org.consensusj.jsonrpc

Basic JSON-RPC Java client and supporting classes. Note the Groovy classes are now in a separate module, but they're still in the diagram to illustrate the purpose of `DynamicRpcMethodSupport`. plantuml::doc/puml/JsonRpcClasses.puml[]
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AsyncSupport
    Helper methods for creating asynchronous calls using CompletableFuture.
    AsyncSupport.ThrowingSupplier<T>
    Subinterface of Supplier for Lambdas which throw exceptions.
    DynamicRpcMethodSupport Deprecated.
    Use JsonRpcClient instead.
    JacksonRpcClient
    Methods for creating Jackson's JavaType for a Jackson-based implementation of {link @JsonRpcClient}.
    JsonRpcClient
    JSON-RPC client interface.
    JsonRpcService
    Asynchronous JSON-RPC Server/Service A service-layer abstraction of JSON-RPC using plain old Java objects (POJOs) Can easily be used in controllers from Java Web frameworks.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractRpcClient
    Abstract Base class for a strongly-typed JSON-RPC client.
    CompositeTrustManager
    A Trust Manager that adds a second trust store (key store) to the default trust store.
    JsonRpcError
    JSON-RPC Error Object POJO
    JsonRpcMessage
    In the future this may be a superclass for JsonRpcRequest and JsonRpcResponse.
    JsonRpcRequest
    JSON-RPC Request POJO
    JsonRpcResponse<R>
    JSON-RPC Response POJO Note that `result` is a parameterized type and can be used to directly map JSON-RPC results to the correct type for each method.
    RpcClient
    JSON-RPC Client using HttpURLConnection.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    JsonRpcError.Error  
    JsonRpcMessage.Version  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    JsonRpcErrorException
    Exception wrapper for JsonRpcError Useful in server implementations, throwing an error that will be transmitted to the client.
    JsonRpcException
    JSON RPC Exception
    JsonRpcStatusException
    JSON-RPC returned HTTP status other than 200 Additional information is usually in JSON-RPC response
